Description: Meets assignment’s technical and design specifications (one page front/back, portrait layout, margins).
Rating_description_1: Follows all format requirements perfectly; layout is professional and makes an amazing first impression.
Rating_description_2: Meets all formatting and length requirements; design consistent with assignment.
Rating_description_3: Makes minor formatting errors or deviates from the length limitation.
Rating_description_4: Makes major formatting and/or layout errors.
Rating_description_5: Formatting not followed. Pages missing, longer than 1 page (front and back), or unreadable.

Description: Makes a positive first impression as a polished, professional document.
Rating_description_1: Makes an outstanding first impression. Appears as a professional piece that could be sent out immediately.
Rating_description_2: Makes a strong first impression. Uses impressive document design.
Rating_description_3: Includes 1 or 2 minor flaws that detract from the first impression.
Rating_description_4: Includes multiple flaws that detract from the first impression. Could not be sent out without extensive revision.
Rating_description_5: Does not make a positive first impression.

Description: Includes a clear and specific title, date, and author’s name.
Rating_description_1: Includes a clear, specific, and engaging title, the current date, and the full name of the author.
Rating_description_2: Title is specific, and the author and date are clearly listed.
Rating_description_3: Title, date, and byline are present but may be vague or inconsistent in format
Rating_description_4: Title, date, or byline is missing or unclear.
Rating_description_5: Title, date, and byline are missing.

Description: Explains the topic and why it matters followed by a bulleted list or outline of the key concepts or issues that will be addressed in the fact sheet.
Rating_description_1: Introduces the topic concisely and engagingly. Clearly explains why the topic matters and what the fact sheet will cover.
Rating_description_2: Introduces and explains the topic and its importance. Identifies what the fact sheet covers.
Rating_description_3: Introduces topic, its significance, and what the fact sheet covers, but the section may be too brief, too long, or unclear.
Rating_description_4: Introduces the topic, but is confusing, poorly written, lacks explanation of importance, and/or omits details on what the fact sheet covers..

Description: Divide the body into distinct sections. Present each section with a clear, informative heading followed by the most important facts about the topic. Explains 3–5 essential facts about the topic in lists, stats, and/or short paragraphs, combining these elements to communicate details fully.
Rating_description_1: Presents 3–5 essential facts using clear lists, statistics, or brief paragraphs; content is well-selected, relevant, and fully explained.
Rating_description_2: Includes 3–5 relevant facts with clearly explained details.
Rating_description_3: Covers fewer than 3 or more than 5 facts, or lacks clear details and explanations.
Rating_description_4: Uses incomplete and/or vague details, OR excessive explanation and details.
Rating_description_5: No body sections (or inadequately developed body sections) are provided.

Description: Summarize the information with quick facts, takeaways, or action steps.
Rating_description_1: Ends with clear, memorable takeaways that reinforce key facts and connect directly to the reader’s needs or next steps.
Rating_description_2: Provides a concise, accurate summary and clear takeaways that reinforce main points.
Rating_description_3: Includes a conclusion but lacks clarity, focus, or complete connection to the main message.
Rating_description_4: Conclusion is weak, repetitive, or too general; lacks clear summary or next steps.

Description: Integrates a minimum of 3 visuals (at least 1 data visualization; no more than 1 photo) that support understanding. Includes captions and textual references. Placed in proximity to textual references.
Rating_description_1: Supports key points with the required visuals. Includes 2-part captions as well as explanation and references in text for each visual. Visuals placed near text references.
Rating_description_2: Includes required visuals with 2-part captions and explanations and references in text. Visuals aid comprehension.
Rating_description_3: Includes required visuals but one or more lacks captions or explanations and references in the text.
Rating_description_4: Does not meet the requirements for the visuals, captions, in-text explanations and references, and/or visual placement.
Rating_description_5: Visuals are missing or do not support the content.

Description: Uses 6–10 credible sources; integrates and cites accurately in discipline style.
Rating_description_1: Provides credible and smoothly integrated sources. Bibliographic citations perfect.
Rating_description_2: Uses required number of credible sources and integrates them into the text. Includes correctly formatted in-text and bibliographic citations.
Rating_description_3: Uses credible sources but minor citation or integration errors.
Rating_description_4: Uses a source that is not credible or not integrated and/or uses incorrectly formatted citations.
Rating_description_5: Includes fewer than 5 credible, integrated sources and/or includes no or inadequate documentation.

Description: Uses plain language, clear explanations, and definitions for non-experts.
Rating_description_1: Simplifies complex ideas for readers accurately. Uses plain language consistently and smoothly.
Rating_description_2: Explains complex ideas for readers well. Uses plain language throughout Defines all necessary terms.
Rating_description_3: Occasionally uses complicated, overly technical, wordy, and/or repetitive phrasing.
Rating_description_4: Frequently uses language that is too technical or confusing.

Description: Uses headings, logical structure, and visual hierarchy to guide readers through the document. Uses CRAP design principles, fonts, chunking, and other formatting elements effectively to increase readability.
Rating_description_1: Uses flawless formatting. Shows strong contrast between headings and the document paragraphs. Uses spacing, fonts, and chunking and CRAP design principles to make the message highly readable and professional.
Rating_description_2: Uses accurate and appropriate formatting. Formats headings, spacing, and CRAP design principles consistently. Uses lists, horizontal rules, and boxes as effective visual elements.
Rating_description_3: May include minor formatting errors and/or includes minor errors in headings, paragraphing, spacing, or application of CRAP design principles.
Rating_description_4: Uses incorrect formatting, inadequate contrast between headings and text, large paragraphs, and/or inaccurate spacing. Inconsistently applies CRAP design principles.
Rating_description_5: Does not meet formatting or design requirements.
